code: @Manual{,   title = {LSVCMM: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model},   author = {Simon Fontaine},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.5},   url = {https://fontaine618.github.io/LSVCMM}, }

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model
text: can install development version LSVCMM GitHub :

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(LSVCMM) instance = generate_synthetic_data() #> New names: #> • `` -> `...1` #> • `` -> `...2` fit = lsvcmm(   data=instance$data,    response="response",   subject="subject_id",   time="time",   vc_covariates="group",   kernel=list(scale=c(0.1, 0.2, 0.3)),   penalty=list(adaptive=0.5, penalize_intercept=T) ) library(ggplot2) ggplot() +    geom_line(     data=fit$results,     mapping=aes(x=penalty.lambda, y=ebich, color=as.factor(kernel.scale), group=kernel.scale)   ) + scale_x_log10() +    theme_minimal() + labs(color="Kernel scale", x="Reg. parameter", y="EBIC") i = which.min(fit$results$ebich) t(fit$vc_path[,,i]) #>             [,1]       [,2] #>  [1,]  0.0000000 -0.1212567 #>  [2,]  0.0000000  0.0000000 #>  [3,]  0.0000000  0.0000000 #>  [4,]  0.0000000  0.0000000 #>  [5,]  0.0000000  0.0000000 #>  [6,]  0.0000000  0.0000000 #>  [7,] -0.1706565  0.9256777 #>  [8,] -0.4979099  1.5050463 #>  [9,]  0.0000000  0.8563264 #> [10,]  0.0000000  0.6370261 #> [11,]  0.0000000  1.0393079 instance$true_values #>    time b0        b1 #> 1   0.0  0 0.0000000 #> 2   0.1  0 0.0000000 #> 3   0.2  0 0.0000000 #> 4   0.3  0 0.0000000 #> 5   0.4  0 0.0000000 #> 6   0.5  0 0.1192029 #> 7   0.6  0 0.5000000 #> 8   0.7  0 0.8807971 #> 9   0.8  0 0.9820138 #> 10  0.9  0 0.9975274 #> 11  1.0  0 0.9996646 fit$results[i, ] #>           llk      rss family.dispersion family.name #> 295 -1223.691 965.8111          1.289467    gaussian #>                    penalty.name penalty.alpha penalty.lambda penalty.adaptive #> 295 adaptive_sparse_group_lasso             1    0.004019454              0.5 #>     penalty.penalize_intercept link_function.name working_covariance.estimate #> 295                       TRUE           identity                       FALSE #>     working_covariance.ratio working_covariance.name kernel.name kernel.scale #> 295                 0.370352       compound_symmetry    gaussian          0.3 #>     control.max_iter control.max_rounds control.rel_tol control.verbose #> 295             1000                 50           1e-06               1 #>     control.update_method control.backtracking_fraction #> 295                   PGD                           0.9 #>     control.two_step_estimation control.stepsize_factor      penalty df #> 295                        TRUE                       1 0.0001054492  8 #>     df_kernel df_logn df_logn_kernel df_max      aic     aich      bic     bich #> 295  1.367732 52.5942       8.991848     22 2463.382 2450.117 2499.976 2456.374 #>         ebic    ebich #> 295 2524.704 2460.601

what: LSVCMM: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model — LSVCMM-package
title: LSVCMM: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model — LSVCMM-package
text: Implements locally sparse varying coefficient mixed model proposed Fontaine et al. (2025+).

title: LSVCMM: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model — LSVCMM-package
text: Maintainer: Simon Fontaine simfont@umich.edu

title: Prepare control arguments — control_args
text: Prepare control arguments

title: Prepare control arguments — control_args
text: args list arguments. See See *Details*.

title: Prepare control arguments — control_args
text: list arguments

title: Prepare control arguments — control_args
text: following arguments supported: max_rounds maximum number rounds coordinate descent (default: 50.) max_iter maximum number iterations per round (default: 1000.) rel_tol relative tolerance convergence (default: 1e-6.) verbose verbosity level. Must 0, 1(default), 2, 3. update_method update method. Currently, "PGD" allowed. backtracking_fraction backtracking fraction. Must 0 1 (default: 0.9.) two_step Whether estimate parameters . Must TRUE (default) FALSE. stepsize_factor Scaling factor multiplying inverse Lipschitz constant. Must positive (default: 1..) ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored.

text: Prepare family arguments

title: Prepare family arguments — family_args
text: args list arguments. See See *Details*.

title: Prepare family arguments — family_args
text: list arguments

title: Prepare family arguments — family_args
text: following arguments supported: response response distribution. Currently, "gaussian" "tweedie" supported. link link function. Currently, "identity" "log" supported. power power Tweedie variance; default 1.5. ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored. argument specified, default value used.

title: Generate synthetic data (group difference) — generate_synthetic_data
text: Generate synthetic data (group difference)

title: Generate synthetic data (group difference) — generate_synthetic_data
code: generate_synthetic_data(   n_subjects = 100,   n_timepoints = 11,   prop_observed = 0.7,   observation_variance = 1,   random_effect_variance_ratio = 1,   random_effect_ar1_correlation = 0.9,   effect_size = 1,   grpdiff_function = "sigmoid",   missingness = "uniform",   seed = 1 )

title: Generate synthetic data (group difference) — generate_synthetic_data
text: n_subjects Number subjects (default 100). Half group 0 half group 1 (average). n_timepoints Number time points data sampled spread regularly \([0,1]\) interval (default 11). prop_observed Proportion observed time points (default 0.7). observation_variance Variance observation error (default 1). random_effect_variance_ratio Ratio variance random effect variance observation error (default 1). random_effect_ar1_correlation Correlation two random effects two consecutive timepoints (default 0.9). effect_size Effect size group (default 1). grpdiff_function Group difference function (implemented: "sigmoid" (default), "sine".) Can also callable function, provided evaluation vectorized. missingness Missing observation mechanism (implemented: "uniform" (default), "contiguous", "sqrt", "fixed_uniform") seed Seed random number generator (default 1).

title: Generate synthetic data (group difference) — generate_synthetic_data
text: list containing following elements: data data frame containing longitudinal data long format. data_wide data frame containing longitudinal data wide format. data_wide_imputed data frame containing longitudinal data wide format imputed missing values. true_values data frame containing true values fixed effects. times vector timepoints data sampled. colnames list containing column names data frames.

title: Generate synthetic data (group difference) — generate_synthetic_data
text: data generated according following model: $$y_{ij} = \beta_0(t_{ij}) + \beta_1(t_{ij}) g_i + \theta_{ij} + \epsilon_{ij}$$ \(y_{ij}\) response subject \(\) time \(j\) time \((t_{ij})\), \(g_i\) group subject \(\), \(\theta_{ij}\) random effect subject \(\) time \(j\), \(\epsilon_{ij}\) observation error subject \(\) time \(j\), \(\beta_0(\cdot)\) intercept function, \(\beta_1(\cdot)\) effect size. random effects generated according multivariate normal distribution mean 0 covariance matrix \(\Sigma\) \(\Sigma_{ij} = r\sigma^2\rho^{|-j|}\) (\(\rho\) defined random_effect_ar1_correlation \(r\) random_effect_variance_ratio). observation errors generated according multivariate normal distribution mean 0 covariance matrix \(\sigma^2 \) (\(\sigma^2\) defined observation_variance). random effects observation errors independent. response generated according logistic function time group: $$f(t) = \frac{1}{1 + \exp((0.6-t)20)}$$ observations sampled uniformly proportion prop_observed timepoints. imputed version data also provided missing values imputed using function [refund::fpca.sc]. data returned three formats: data data frame containing longitudinal data long format. data_wide data frame containing longitudinal data wide format. data_wide_imputed data frame containing longitudinal data wide format imputed missing values.

title: Generate synthetic data (multiple features) — generate_synthetic_data_p
text: Generate synthetic data (multiple features)

title: Generate synthetic data (multiple features) — generate_synthetic_data_p
code: generate_synthetic_data_p(   n_subjects = 100,   n_timepoints = 11,   n_features = 2,   feature_type = "binary",   observation_variance = 1,   random_effect_variance_ratio = 1,   random_effect_ar1_correlation = 0.9,   effect_size = 1,   effect_groupsparsity = 0.5,   effect_sparsity = 0.5,   prop_observed = 0.7,   missingness = "uniform",   seed = 1 )

title: Generate synthetic data (multiple features) — generate_synthetic_data_p
text: n_subjects Number subjects (default 100). n_timepoints Number time points data sampled spread regularly \([0,1]\) interval (default 11). n_features Number features addition intercept (default 2). feature_type Type feature (implemented: "binary" (default), "uniform", "normal"). observation_variance Variance observation error (default 1). random_effect_variance_ratio Ratio variance random effect variance observation error (default 1). random_effect_ar1_correlation Correlation two random effects two consecutive timepoints (default 0.9). effect_size Effect size features (default 1). effect_groupsparsity Proportion features effect (default 0.5). effect_sparsity Proportion domain null effect (default 0.5). prop_observed Proportion observed time points (default 0.7). missingness Missing observation mechanism (implemented: "uniform" (default), "contiguous", "sqrt", "fixed_uniform") seed Seed random number generator (default 1).

title: Generate synthetic data (multiple features) — generate_synthetic_data_p
text: list containing following elements: data data frame containing longitudinal data long format. data_wide data frame containing longitudinal data wide format. data_wide_imputed data frame containing longitudinal data wide format imputed missing values. true_values data frame containing true values fixed effects. times vector timepoints data sampled. colnames list containing column names data frames.

title: Generate synthetic data (multiple features) — generate_synthetic_data_p
text: data generated according following model: $$y_{ij} = \beta_0(t_{ij}) + \sum_{k=1}^{p} \beta_k(t_{ij}) x_{ik} + \theta_{ij} + \epsilon_{ij}$$ \(y_{ij}\) \(j\)th response subject \(\), time \((t_{ij})\), \(x_{ik}\) \(k\)th feature subject \(\), \(\theta_{ij}\) random effect subject \(\) time \(j\), \(\epsilon_{ij}\) observation error subject \(\) time \(j\), \(\beta_0(\cdot)\) intercept function, \(\beta_1(\cdot)\) effect size. random effects generated according multivariate normal distribution mean 0 covariance matrix \(\Sigma\) \(\Sigma_{ij} = r\sigma^2\rho^{|-j|}\) (\(\rho\) defined random_effect_ar1_correlation \(r\) random_effect_variance_ratio). observation errors generated according multivariate normal distribution mean 0 covariance matrix \(\sigma^2 \) (\(\sigma^2\) defined observation_variance). random effects observation errors independent. observations sampled uniformly proportion prop_observed timepoints. imputed version data also provided missing values imputed using function [refund::fpca.sc]. data returned three formats: data data frame containing longitudinal data long format. data_wide data frame containing longitudinal data wide format. data_wide_imputed data frame containing longitudinal data wide format imputed missing values.

text: args list arguments. See *Details*.

title: Prepare kernel arguments — kernel_args
text: list arguments

title: Prepare kernel arguments — kernel_args
text: following arguments supported: name kernel function. Currently, "gaussian" supported. scale scale parameter. NULL, logarithmic grid search used. n_scale number scale parameters use scale NULL (default.) rescale_boundary Whether resscale kernel boundary (default: TRUE.) ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored. grid search, range defined \([L, U]\) \(L\) half smallest gap estimated time points \(U\) twice range estimated time points.

text: Title

title: Title — lsvcmm.boot
code: lsvcmm.boot(   data,   response,   subject,   time,   vc_covariates = NULL,   nvc_covariates = NULL,   offset = NULL,   weight = NULL,   add_intercept = T,   estimated_time = NULL,   family = DEFAULT_FAMILY_ARGS,   kernel = DEFAULT_KERNEL_ARGS,   penalty = DEFAULT_PENALTY_ARGS,   working_covariance = DEFAULT_WORKING_COVARIANCE_ARGS,   control = DEFAULT_CONTROL_ARGS,   n_samples = 1000,   resample_within_subject = F )

title: Title — lsvcmm.boot
text: data data frame containing variables model. response name response variable data. subject name subject variable data. time name time variable data. vc_covariates names varying coefficient covariates data. nvc_covariates names non-varying coefficient covariates data. offset name offset variable data. weight name weight variable data. add_intercept Whether add intercept model. estimated_time time points estimate varying coefficients. missing, observed time points used. family list arguments response distribution. See family_args. kernel list arguments kernel. See kernel_args. penalty list arguments penalty. See penalty_args. working_covariance list arguments working covariance. See working_covariance_args. control list arguments control parameters. See control_args. n_samples Number bootstrap samples compute resample_within_subject Whether resample within subjects

title: Title — lsvcmm.boot
text: list containing following elements: family list arguments response distribution. See family_args. kernel list arguments kernel. See kernel_args. penalty list arguments penalty. See penalty_args. working_covariance list arguments working covariance. See working_covariance_args. control list arguments control parameters. See control_args. results data frame containing results optimization. row model resulting particular tuning parameter combination. nvc_boot matrix containing estimated non-varying coefficient path dimension (p_u, n_samples). vc_boot array containing estimated varying coefficient path dimension (p_x, n_timepoints, n_samples). scaled_time time points varying coefficients estimated. unscaled_time corresponding values original scale. range_time range time points. full_model model fitted data. nvc vector containing estimated non-varying coefficient. vc matrix containing estimated varying coefficient.

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
text: data data frame containing variables model. response name response variable data. subject name subject variable data. time name time variable data. vc_covariates names varying coefficient covariates data. nvc_covariates names non-varying coefficient covariates data. offset name offset variable data. weight name weight variable data. add_intercept Whether add intercept model. estimated_time time points estimate varying coefficients. missing, observed time points used. family list arguments response distribution. See family_args. kernel list arguments kernel. See kernel_args. penalty list arguments penalty. See penalty_args. working_covariance list arguments working covariance. See working_covariance_args. control list arguments control parameters. See control_args. return_models Whether return fitted models.

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
text: list containing following elements: family list arguments response distribution. See family_args. kernel list arguments kernel. See kernel_args. penalty list arguments penalty. See penalty_args. working_covariance list arguments working covariance. See working_covariance_args. control list arguments control parameters. See control_args. results data frame containing results optimization. row model resulting particular tuning parameter combination. nvc_path matrix containing estimated non-varying coefficient path dimension (p_u, n_models). vc_path array containing estimated varying coefficient path dimension (p_x, n_timepoints, n_models). scaled_time time points varying coefficients estimated. unscaled_time corresponding values original scale. range_time range time points. models list fitted models.

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
text: lsvcmm function fits locally sparse varying coefficient mixed model (LSVCMM) longitudinal data. LSVCMM semiparametric model longitudinal data allows coefficients non-varying covariates vary smoothly time. model defined $$Y_{ij} = \beta_0(t_{ij}) + \sum_{k=1}^p \beta_k(t_{ij}) X_{ijk} + \epsilon_{ij},$$ \(Y_{ij}\) response \(\)-th subject time \(t_{ij}\), \(X_{ijk}\) \(k\)-th non-varying covariate \(\)-th subject time \(t_{ij}\), \(\beta_0(t)\) intercept function, \(\beta_k(t)\) coefficient function \(k\)-th non-varying covariate, \(\epsilon_{ij}\) error term.

title: Prepare penalty arguments — penalty_args
text: Prepare penalty arguments

title: Prepare penalty arguments — penalty_args
text: args list arguments. See See *Details*.

title: Prepare penalty arguments — penalty_args
text: list arguments

title: Prepare penalty arguments — penalty_args
text: following arguments supported: name penalty function. Currently, "adaptive_sparse_group_lasso" supported. alpha mixing parameter. Must 0 1. 1 pure Lasso (default); 0 pure group Lasso. SCAD parameter, requires >=2. Default: 3.7. lambda penalty parameter. NULL (default), logarithmic grid search used. n_lambda number penalty parameters use lambda NULL (default.) lambda_factor factor penalty parameter reduced overall (default: 1e-4.) adaptive adaptive parameter. Must non-negative (default: 0..) penalize_intercept Whether penalize intercept. Must TRUE (default) FALSE. ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored. grid search, first obtain minimum \(\lambda_\max\) solution zero. , logarithmically-space sequence \(\lambda\) values generated starting  \(\lambda_\max\) ending \(\lambda_\max \times \texttt{lambda_factor}\).

text: list arguments

title: Prepare working covariance arguments — working_covariance_args
text: following arguments supported: name working covariance function. Currently, "compound_symmetry" supported. estimate Whether estimate parameters. Must TRUE (default) FALSE. ratio ratio variance random effects variance error term. negative (default), ratio estimated `log(n)`. correlation correlation AR(1).

title: Version 0.0.5
text: Added new data generation multiple covariates

title: Version 0.0.4
text: Refactored link function interface; added log link Refactored family interface; added tweedie New p-value computation

title: Version 0.0.3
text: Added bootstrap simultaneous confidence bands. Added observation weights Added resampling within subjects bootstrap

title: Version 0.0.2
text: Updated computation EBIC (previously wrong) Updated computation profile likelihood covariance update (previously using dispersion) Made Kernel abstract added Epanechnikov kernel Made WorkingCovariance abstract Independent added AR(1) AR(1) estimation currently working. Improve stepsize adaptation dropped backtracking line search Added sine function data generation Data generation now allows user-supplied group difference function Made penalty abstract added SCAD MCP Uniformize initialization independent MLE Added rescaling kernel boundary Initialize covariance parameters unpenalized independent model Enable two-step estimation covariance parameters fixed initialization Added profiling identify expensive functions Improve stepsize adaptation Gradient Hessian rescaling using total weights Added sqrt*sqrt missing value mechanism

title: Version 0.0.1
text: First release Added documentation resolved R CMD CHECK warnings notes.
